body:
Same with `debian/stretch64`:
```Shell
> /usr/bin/curl -I -q --fail --location --max-redirs 10 --user-agent "Vagrant/1.9.1 \
(+https://www.vagrantup.com; ruby2.3.3)" --continue-at - \
-H "Accept: application/json" https://atlas.hashicorp.com/debian/stretch64
HTTP/1.1 200 Connection established

curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
```

At this time "_All Systems Operational_" https://status.hashicorp.com ...
Testet this with a lot of different boxes including ubuntu/xenial64, centos/7 and laravel/homestead. All gives 404.
Same here for ubuntu/xenial64 ... At least it doesn't seem to be our firewall anymore ^^
I'm wondering if this is related to Vagrant Cloud now being the source for Vagrant boxes. Perhaps HashiCorp Atlas removed its redirects recently? Going to experiment with this a bit.

Upgraded to Vagrant 2.0.2 and it started working. 
Version 1.9.1 is latest in ubuntu 17.10, so anyone running ubuntu need to fetch the latest version from the vagrant homepage.

A workarround to add in your **Vagrantfile**:
```Ruby
Vagrant::DEFAULT_SERVER_URL.replace('https://vagrantcloud.com')
```
Can't explain why it started working on my machine then. Sorry.

issue.title: Vagrant box currently unavailable [2-24-18]

repository.name: securedrop
repository.description: GitHub repository for the SecureDrop whistleblower platform. Do not submit tips here!

issue.body:
# Bug

## Description

As of 10:00 UTC 02/24/18 `bento/ubuntu-14.04` has returned '404 not found', although it's listed on [Vagrant Cloud](https://app.vagrantup.com/bento/boxes/ubuntu-14.04). Randomly found this out when attempting to stand up the environment just so I could check a quick assumption. 

```
kevin@helios:~/dev/securedrop$ vagrant up /staging/
Bringing machine 'mon-staging' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
Bringing machine 'app-staging' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
==> mon-staging: Checking if box 'bento/ubuntu-14.04' is up to date...
==> mon-staging: There was a problem while downloading the metadata for your box
==> mon-staging: to check for updates. This is not an error, since it is usually due
==> mon-staging: to temporary network problems. This is just a warning. The problem
==> mon-staging: encountered was:
==> mon-staging: 
==> mon-staging: The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
==> mon-staging: 
==> mon-staging: If you want to check for box updates, verify your network connection
==> mon-staging: is valid and try again.
Your VM has become "inaccessible." Unfortunately, this is a critical error
with VirtualBox that Vagrant can not cleanly recover from. Please open VirtualBox
and clear out your inaccessible virtual machines or find a way to fix
them.
kevin@helios:~/dev/securedrop$ vagrant box update
==> app-prod: Checking for updates to 'bento/ubuntu-14.04'
    app-prod: Latest installed version: 201710.25.0
    app-prod: Version constraints: 
    app-prod: Provider: virtualbox
There was an error while downloading the metadata for this box.
The error message is shown below:

The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
```

## Steps to Reproduce

Try to `up` the environment or `box update`. 

## Expected Behavior

The image is served from HashiCorp's server and downloads. 

## Actual Behavior

Not Found response is returned.

## Comments

I submitted this as #6420 to [support.hashicorp.com](https://support.hashicorp.com) and will update if there is anything. I also did a quick Wireshark packet capture but it was all TLS so at first couldn't determine the actual URLs of the boxes. I did some guessing/Google'ing around and determined that it was likely https://hashicorp-files.hashicorp.com/bento/ubuntu-14.04.box and confirmed in curl/wget that it is 404.

Interestingly, they also have some older infrastructure on https://atlas.hashicorp.com/bento/boxes/ubuntu-14.04 which explicitly says it is being decommissioned.

body:
I had the same issue. Updated to v2.0.2 but updates were still downloaded from atlas. New installs work fine.
Looks like this is a caching error: Vagrant stores in a file where it downloaded the box from.
So find all `$VAGRANT_HOME/boxes/[box-slug]/metadata_url` files and replace `atlas.hashicorp.com` with `vagrantcloud.com`. After that box updates should work fine again.

I'm not a find/xarg/sed pro but I bet someone will come up with a one-liner to replace all occurrences automatically

That looks like the underlying cause @HenningCash. Thank you!

```
$ cat ~/.vagrant.d/boxes/ubuntu-VAGRANTSLASH-xenial64/metadata_url
https://atlas.hashicorp.com/ubuntu/xenial64
```

After fixing this I was able to successfully download the box update. 

Since I had been using a version earlier than Vagrant 2.0.2 when I originally downloaded this box's metadata the `metadata_url` for each box was still cached against Atlas.

```
sed -i -- 's/atlas.hashicorp/vagrantcloud/g' ~/.vagrant.d/boxes/*/metadata_url
```

This seems to work for me (on an Ubuntu 16.04 host).
A better solution would be to setup a redirection on the web server of atlas.hashicorp. My 2 cents...

issue.title: geerlingguy/ubuntu1604 not found on atlas.hashicorp.com
issue.body:
<!--- Drupal VM is used by developers in a wide variety of circumstances. Please use this template when reporting issues or suggesting features so we can help you more efficiently. **Delete this section** and fill in the rest of the template below, deleting the commented sections -->

### Issue Type

 - Bug Report / Support Request

### Your Environment

<!--- Paste the output from the following command: `vagrant --version && echo "VirtualBox `vboxmanage --version`" && ansible --version` (paste it in the space between the three graves) -->
```
Vagrant 2.0.2
VirtualBox 5.2.6r120293
ansible 2.4.3.0
```

### Your OS

<!--- Pick one below and delete the rest: -->
 - **macOS** (10.11.6 (15G17023))

### Full console output

<!--- If this is a Bug Report / Support Request, please copy the ENTIRE contents of your console (including the command that was run), paste it into a new Gist on https://gist.github.com, then paste the link to the gist here. -->

https://gist.github.com/rpkoller/b78842151225dae594ef8dbe42d48e48

### Summary

When I try to update the box with `vagrant box update` the download fails while trying to check for updates on https://atlas.hashicorp.com/geerlingguy/ubuntu1604 . When I check the link directly in the browser the box is also not found: 

```
404 Not Found

Sorry, the page /geerlingguy/ubuntu1604 could not be found.

This error could mean one of three things:

The resource doesn't exist
The resource exists, but requires proper authorization to access
The resource exists, but its owner organization is delinquent
If someone has linked you to this resource, ensure that they have given you proper permissions to access it.
```
The box got deleted or is an update underway? Best regards r.

issue.title: 404 https://atlas.hashicorp.com/scotch/box

repository.name: scotch-box
repository.description: Scotch Box is a preconfigured Vagrant Box with a full array of LAMP Stack features to get you up and running with Vagrant in no time.

issue.body:
Hi - when installing ( vagrant up ) I get the following error: 

The box 'scotch/box' could not be found or
could not be accessed in the remote catalog. If this is a private
box on HashiCorp's Atlas, please verify you're logged in via
`vagrant login`. Also, please double-check the name. The expanded
URL and error message are shown below:

URL: ["https://atlas.hashicorp.com/scotch/box"]
Error: The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found


Please help - much appreciated

body: This is effecting all boxes. Anyone clarify what's happening here exactly?
@whatnickcodes : HashCorp's SysOps/DevOps/WhaterverOps removed previous Vagrant URL redirections from atlas.hashicorp.com to vagrantcloud.com too quickly.
